intro: Mammillaria difficilis, commonly known as the Mexican Hedgehog Cactus, is a species native to Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus with a globular shape and a distinctive yellowish-green color. The plant features a dense covering of white, woolly hairs that help protect it from intense sunlight and dehydration. It produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a striking contrast to its foliage. Due to its slow growth and specific care requirements, it is a popular choice among cactus enthusiasts.
